comment.author: 37244380@N00
comment._content:
Wonderful, so full of interest.

I'm surprised to see it was already necessary to put stanchions at the pedestrian entrances to prevent vehicles using them.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: Thanks for pointing that out, cogito ergo imago. I had never noticed the bollards (or stanchions) at the pedestrian entrances until now. Would you call them bollards today in North America?

comment.author: 37244380@N00
comment._content:
Yes, 'bollard' seems to be the better choice of word - apparently 'stanchion' implies a structural support function.

I'm not the one to opine on North American usage - I'm a kiwi.  (And a lifelong fan of Australia; love these old photos you post.)

comment.author: 37176023@N08
comment._content: Fascinating. As a child in Brisbane during the 1950s, I can remember walking past those bollards.
